project.utilsÂ¶

project.utils.docxÂ¶

project.utils.docx.create_pygenometracks_plot(reference_genome, annotation, region, bed_path, bigwig_file, bigwig_consensus_file, output_dir, sample_name, user_lab)[source]Â¶

Generate a genome coverage plot using pyGenomeTracks for a specific user_lab.

Creates a tracks.ini file that includes:

  • a reference track (from the provided FASTA),

  • an annotation track (from the provided GFF3), and

  • a bigwig track (from the provided BigWig file).

The plot is generated for the given region.

project.utils.docx.generate_docx_report(report_data, base_dir, role, user_lab, distribution)[source]Â¶

Route for generating the DOCX report.

project.utils.docx.generate_sample_plot_pdf(sample_name, sample_data, role)[source]Â¶

Generates a Matplotlib stacked bar and line graph with dual y-axes for a single sample.

project.utils.report_parserÂ¶

project.utils.report_parser.parse_nextclade_file(nextclade_file_path, nextclade_alternative_file_path, genomeLength)[source]Â¶

Parses Nextclade output and calculates uniformity based on coverage and mutations.

project.utils.report_parser.parse_qualimap(genome_results_path, coverage_histogram_path)[source]Â¶

Parses Qualimap genome_results.txt and coverage histogram file.

project.utils.report_parser.process_all_reports(base_dir)[source]Â¶

Processes all samples in the given directory and extracts relevant metrics.

project.utils.report_parser.read_genome_length(sample_path)[source]Â¶

Reads genome length from genomeLength.txt, handling missing file cases.

project.utils.sql_modelsÂ¶

class project.utils.sql_models.Distribution(**kwargs)[source]Â¶
query: t.ClassVar[Query]Â¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

Frontend DocumentationÂ¶

Here is the documentation for the frontend (React) code:

class App(props)Â¶

Main application component. Manages user authentication, routing, and layout rendering.

Initializes the App component and sets initial state.

Arguments:

  • props (Object) â Component properties.

App.checkLoginStatus()Â¶

Checks the userâs login status by making an API call. Updates state accordingly.

App.componentDidMount()Â¶

Lifecycle method that runs when the component mounts. Checks login status and adds event listener for window resize.

App.componentWillUnmount()Â¶

Lifecycle method that runs when the component unmounts. Removes event listener for window resize.

App.handleLogin(event)Â¶

Handles user login by sending credentials to API.

Arguments:

  • event (Event) â Form submit event.

App.handleLogout()Â¶

Handles user logout by making an API call.

App.handleResize()Â¶

Updates window width state when resized.

App.render()Â¶

Main render function.

App.renderApp()Â¶

Renders the main application when the user is logged in.

App.renderLoginForm()Â¶

Renders the login form when the user is not authenticated.
